definition[0]: a legal agreement in which someone promises to pay a person or organization an amount of money regularly
definition[1]: a formal written agreement to do something or not to do something, or to pay an amount of money
example[0]: We are tied by a covenant which prohibits the stadium from being put to any other use.
example[1]: The covenant to pay the rent on the due date is absolutely fundamental.
example[2]: Under this ruling, the landlord would not have a claim against the tenant for breach of covenant (=breaking the agreement).
